results.title: Effects of simvastatin on the development of the atrial fibrillation substrate in dogs with congestive heart failure.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: @SPECIES_9615 @@@Dogs@@@ were subjected to 2-week @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular tachypacing@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@VTP@@@) in the absence and presence of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (20 or 80 mg/day) or @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@.

citations.NLM: Shiroshita-Takeshita A, Brundel BJ, Burstein B, Leung TK, Mitamura H, Ogawa S, Nattel S. Effects of simvastatin on the development of the atrial fibrillation substrate in dogs with congestive heart failure. Cardiovasc Res. 2007 Apr 1;74(1):75-84. PMID: 17270161
citations.BibTeX: @article{17270161, title={Effects of simvastatin on the development of the atrial fibrillation substrate in dogs with congestive heart failure.}, author={Shiroshita-Takeshita A and Brundel BJ and Burstein B and Leung TK and Mitamura H and Ogawa S and Nattel S}, journal={Cardiovasc Res}, volume={74}, number={1}, pages={75-84}}

results.title: Effects of simvastatin on blood lipids, vitamin E, coenzyme Q10 levels and left ventricular function in humans.
results.text_hl: Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on blood @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipids@@@, @CHEMICAL_Vitamin_E @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014810 @@@vitamin E@@@, @CHEMICAL_coenzyme_Q10 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C024989 @@@coenzyme Q10@@@ levels and left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ function in @SPECIES_9606 @@@humans@@@.

citations.NLM: Colquhoun DM, Jackson R, Walters M, Hicks BJ, Goldsmith J, Young P, Strakosch C, Kostner KM. Effects of simvastatin on blood lipids, vitamin E, coenzyme Q10 levels and left ventricular function in humans. Eur J Clin Invest. 2005 Apr;35(4):251-8. PMID: 15816994
citations.BibTeX: @article{15816994, title={Effects of simvastatin on blood lipids, vitamin E, coenzyme Q10 levels and left ventricular function in humans.}, author={Colquhoun DM and Jackson R and Walters M and Hicks BJ and Goldsmith J and Young P and Strakosch C and Kostner KM}, journal={Eur J Clin Invest}, volume={35}, number={4}, pages={251-8}}

results.title: Protective effect of simvastatin and VULM 1457 in ischaemic-reperfused myocardium of the diabetic-hypercholesterolemic rats.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_VULM_1457 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C505646 @@@VULM 1457@@@ with the shown hypolipidemic effect, significantly (p < 0.01) suppressed a formation of @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@VF@@@ (38% and 29%; respectively).

citations.NLM: Adameová A, Kuzelová M, Faberová V, Svec P. Protective effect of simvastatin and VULM 1457 in ischaemic-reperfused myocardium of the diabetic-hypercholesterolemic rats. Pharmazie. 2006 Sep;61(9):807-8. PMID: 17020164
citations.BibTeX: @article{17020164, title={Protective effect of simvastatin and VULM 1457 in ischaemic-reperfused myocardium of the diabetic-hypercholesterolemic rats.}, author={Adameová A and Kuzelová M and Faberová V and Svec P}, journal={Pharmazie}, volume={61}, number={9}, pages={807-8}}

results.title: [Simvastatin inhibits hypertension-induced cardiac hypertrophy in rats through activation of heme oxygenase-1/carbon monoxide pathway].
results.text_hl: However, compared with the model group, @CHEMICAL_Nitroarginine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019335 @@@L-NNA@@@-induced @DISEASE_Cardiomegaly @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@ of @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ was significantly relieved in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment groups, associated with improved left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular function@@@, decreased LVMI, lower @GENE_NPPB @GENE_25105 @@@BNP@@@ levels in plasma and myocardium, lower content of myocardial @CHEMICAL_Hydroxyproline @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006909 @@@hydroxyproline@@@, and increased myocardial heme oxygenase (HO) activity.

citations.NLM: Yao HM, Wu XS, Zhang J, Geng B, Tang CS. [Simvastatin inhibits hypertension-induced cardiac hypertrophy in rats through activation of heme oxygenase-1/carbon monoxide pathway]. Sheng Li Xue Bao. 2006 Apr 25;58(2):116-23. PMID: 16628357
citations.BibTeX: @article{16628357, title={[Simvastatin inhibits hypertension-induced cardiac hypertrophy in rats through activation of heme oxygenase-1/carbon monoxide pathway].}, author={Yao HM and Wu XS and Zhang J and Geng B and Tang CS}, journal={Sheng Li Xue Bao}, volume={58}, number={2}, pages={116-23}}

results.title: The activation of PI 3-kinase/Akt pathway is involved in the acute effects of simvastatin against ischaemia and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in anaesthetised dogs.
results.text_hl: Compared to the controls, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ markedly reduced the severity of @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischaemia@@@ (epicardial ST-segment, inhomogeneity) and @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@ventricular arrhythmias@@@ that were reversed (except the occlusion-induced @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular fibrillation@@@ [@DISEASE_Paroxysmal_ventricular_fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:C537182 @@@VF@@@; 50%, 0%, 0%]) by the administration of @CHEMICAL_Wortmannin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077191 @@@wortmannin@@@.

citations.NLM: Kisvári G, Kovács M, Seprényi G, Végh Á. The activation of PI 3-kinase/Akt pathway is involved in the acute effects of simvastatin against ischaemia and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in anaesthetised dogs. Eur J Pharmacol. 2015 Dec 15;769():185-94. PMID: 26597117
citations.BibTeX: @article{26597117, title={The activation of PI 3-kinase/Akt pathway is involved in the acute effects of simvastatin against ischaemia and reperfusion-induced arrhythmias in anaesthetised dogs.}, author={Kisvári G and Kovács M and Seprényi G and Végh Á}, journal={Eur J Pharmacol}, volume={769}, pages={185-94}}
